title: Make the most of ESA’s Industry Space Days 2024
summary: Participants of ESA’s Industry Space Days (ISD 2024) share insights and tips on how to make the most of this space technology business event on 18–19 September at ESA-ESTEC in Noordwijk, The Netherlands.

title: Rocket engine startup Ursa Major adds 3D printing lab in Ohio
summary: Ursa Major's expansion in Ohio builds upon its existing Advanced Manufacturing Lab, established in 2021

title: New Frontier Aerospace tests rocket engine for point-to-point travel
summary: A space transportation startup with visions of high-speed point-to-point travel has started tests of the engine that will power their vehicle.

title: SpaceX completes Falcon 9 static fire test amid return to flight campaign
summary: An upper stage anomaly during the Starlink 9-3 mission on July 11 grounded the Falcon 9 rocket. The FAA is evaluating SpaceX’s request for a public safety determination to resume launches.

title: NASA’s FY2025 Budget Proposal Would Doom Chandra
summary: If Congress adopts NASA’s FY2025 astrophysics budget request, the Chandra X-ray telescope cannot continue to operate according to an independent review. Chandra advocates have been raising the alarm since the […]

title: 55 Years Ago: One Year Before the Moon Landing
summary: In July 1968, much work still remained to meet the goal President John F. Kennedy set in May 1961, to land a man on the Moon and return him safely to the Earth before the end of the decade. No American astronaut had flown in space since the November 1966 flight of Gemini XII, the […]

title: 25 Years Ago: STS-93, Launch of the Chandra X-Ray Observatory
summary: On July 23, 1999, space shuttle Columbia took to the skies on its 26th trip into space, to deliver its heaviest payload ever – the Chandra X-ray Observatory. The STS-93 crew included Commander Eileen M. Collins, the first woman to command a space shuttle mission, Pilot Jeffrey S. Ashby, and Mission Specialists Catherine “Cady” G. […]

title: WestJet Partners with TELUS To Revolutionize Inflight Connectivity With Starlink
summary: WestJet Partners with TELUS To Revolutionize Inflight Connectivity With Starlink

title: UPDATE: NASA, Boeing to Stream Flight Test Mission Briefing on NASA+
summary: NASA and Boeing will host a news conference with mission leadership at 11:30 a.m. EDT Thursday, July 25, to provide the latest status of the agency’s Boeing Crew Flight Test aboard the International Space Station. NASA previously planned an audio-only media teleconference to host the discussion. The agency will provide live coverage on NASA+, NASA […]

title: Thales Alenia Space To Lead Consortium for French DIANE Satellite Capture & Inspection Mission
